question_stem.en: A 75-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after he was found unresponsive at home. The patient has a history of poorly controlled hypertension. Blood pressure is 240/120 mm Hg and pulse is 104 /min. He has extensor posturing and pinpoint pupils. CT scan of the head without contrast reveals an acute pontine hemorrhage with associated mass effect. The patient dies several hours later. Autopsy reveals disruption of all pigmented neurons in the posterior rostral pons at the lateral floor of the fourth ventricle. These neurons normally produce which of the following?
question_stem.zh: 一名75岁男性被送往急诊科，此前在家中被发现无反应。患者有既往病史，患有控制不佳的高血压。血压为240/120 mmHg，脉搏为104次/分钟。他有伸展姿势和针尖样瞳孔。头部CT扫描（未用对比剂）显示急性脑桥出血，并伴有相关占位效应。患者数小时后死亡。尸检显示第四脑室外侧底后部吻端脑桥内所有色素神经元受损。这些神经元通常产生以下哪种物质？

explanation.en:
This patient had a hypertensive hemorrhage in the pons at the level of the locus ceruleus, a paired pigmented brainstem nucleus located in the posterior rostral pons near the lateral floor of the fourth ventricle. The locus ceruleus functions as the principal site for norepinephrine synthesis in the brain and projects to virtually all parts of the central nervous system. It is involved in the control of mood, AROUSAL (reticular activating system), sleep-wake states, cognition, and autonomic function (eg, blood pressure control). Abnormal activation of the locus ceruleus has been implicated in the pathogenesis of anxiety disorders (eg, panic attacks).

Patients with bilateral pontine hemorrhage typically present with coma due to disruption of the reticular activating system. Other features usually include total paralysis with extensor posturing due to corticospinal and corticobulbar tract injury and pinpoint pupils secondary to descending sympathetic tract damage.

(Choice A) Dopamine is produced in the ventral tegmental area and substantia nigra pars compacta located in the midbrain. The major dopaminergic pathways in the brain include the mesolimbic and mesocortical pathways (regulate cognition and behavior), the nigrostriatal pathway (regulates coordination of voluntary movements), and the tuberoinfundibular pathway (inhibits prolactin secretion).

(Choice B) Dynorphin is an opioid peptide that modulates the pain response. It is produced mostly in the periaqueductal gray, rostral ventral medulla, and dorsal horn of the spinal cord.

(Choice C) Norepinephrine is converted to epinephrine primarily in the adrenal medulla. Both of these neurotransmitters are released by the adrenal glands into the circulation after stimulation by sympathetic cholinergic preganglionic neurons.

(Choices D and F) Histamine and orexin are produced in the posterior hypothalamus and play an important role in arousal and wakefulness.

(Choices G and H) Oxytocin and vasopressin (antidiuretic hormone) are hormones produced by the hypothalamus and released from the posterior pituitary. Oxytocin promotes milk letdown and uterine contractions, whereas vasopressin causes vasoconstriction and free water reabsorption in the renal collecting ducts.

Educational objective:
The locus ceruleus is a paired brainstem nucleus located in the posterior rostral pons near the lateral floor of the fourth ventricle and functions as the principal site for norepinephrine synthesis in the brain. It projects to virtually all parts of the central nervous system and helps control mood, arousal (reticular activating system), sleep-wake states, cognition, and autonomic function.
explanation.zh:
该患者患有高血压引起的脑桥出血，出血部位位于蓝斑，蓝斑是一个成对的色素性脑干核，位于后部吻端脑桥内，靠近第四脑室的外侧底。蓝斑是大脑中去甲肾上腺素合成的主要部位，并投射到中枢神经系统的几乎所有部分。它参与情绪、唤醒（网状激活系统）、睡眠-觉醒状态、认知和自主神经功能（如血压控制）的控制。蓝斑的异常激活与焦虑症（如惊恐发作）的发病机制有关。

双侧脑桥出血患者通常表现为昏迷，原因是网状激活系统受损。其他特征通常包括由于皮质脊髓束和皮质延髓束损伤引起的完全瘫痪伴伸展姿势，以及继发于下行交感神经束损伤的针尖样瞳孔。

（选项 A）多巴胺产生于中脑的腹侧被盖区和黑质致密部。大脑中的主要多巴胺能通路包括中脑边缘和中脑皮质通路（调节认知和行为）、黑质纹状体通路（调节随意运动的协调）和结节漏斗通路（抑制催乳素分泌）。

（选项 B）强啡肽是一种调节疼痛反应的阿片肽。它主要产生于导水管周围灰质、吻侧腹髓和脊髓后角。

（选项 C）去甲肾上腺素主要在肾上腺髓质中转化为肾上腺素。这两种神经递质均由肾上腺在受到交感神经胆碱能神经节前神经元的刺激后释放到循环中。

（选项 D 和 F）组胺和食欲素产生于下丘脑后部，并在唤醒和清醒中发挥重要作用。

（选项 G 和 H）催产素和加压素（抗利尿激素）是由下丘脑产生的激素，并从垂体后叶释放。催产素促进泌乳和子宫收缩，而加压素引起血管收缩和肾脏集合管中的自由水重吸收。

教育目标：
蓝斑是一个成对的脑干核，位于后部吻端脑桥内，靠近第四脑室的外侧底，是大脑中去甲肾上腺素合成的主要部位。它投射到中枢神经系统的几乎所有部分，有助于控制情绪、唤醒（网状激活系统）、睡眠-觉醒状态、认知和自主神经功能。

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the neuroanatomy of the brainstem, specifically the location and function of the locus ceruleus, and the neurotransmitter it produces. It also tests understanding of the clinical presentation of pontine hemorrhage. 

To solve this question, recognize the key findings of pontine hemorrhage (hypertension, pinpoint pupils, extensor posturing, coma) and correlate the autopsy findings (disruption of neurons in the locus ceruleus) with the neurotransmitter produced by those neurons (norepinephrine).
summary.zh:
此题考察了脑干的神经解剖学知识，特别是蓝斑的位置和功能，以及它产生的神经递质。同时也考察了对脑桥出血临床表现的理解。

要解决这个问题，需要识别脑桥出血的关键发现（高血压、针尖样瞳孔、伸展姿势、昏迷），并将尸检结果（蓝斑神经元受损）与这些神经元产生的神经递质（去甲肾上腺素）相关联。
